raw_description: Participant Identification Number (PIN) specify CPMS Site code (hyphen) four to six digit number patient number e.g. Y0401-0001.
arc_description: Participant Identification Number (PIN) The Participant Identification Number or PIN is a unique number used to identify the patient's (participant's) data.
Date of enrolment / start of data collection This refers to the date of enrolment / start of data collection.
Sex at birth This refers to the physical sexual characteristics at birth.
Age This refers to the patient's age.
Age units This refers to the patient's age at presentation to the health facility.

Race (select all that apply) This refers to a geographic ancestral origin category that is assigned to a population group based mainly on physical characteristics that are thought to be distinct and inherent.
arc_response: [['1', 'Arab'], ['2', 'Black'], ['3', 'East Asian'], ['4', 'South Asian'], ['5', 'South-East Asian'], ['6', 'West Asian'], ['7', 'Latin American'], ['8', 'White'], ['9', 'Aboriginal/First Nations/Indigenous'], ['88', 'Other'], ['99', 'Unknown']]
